alert.note: Alert for Brewster (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 11 at 10:04AM CDT until October 13 at 4:42PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Rio Grande at Boquillas affecting Brewster County. .The Rio Grande will rise to moderate flood stage due to runoff from recent rainfall. The river is expected to crest this afternoon and fall below flood stage overnight. For the Rio Grande...including Presidio 6WNW, Presidio International Bridge, Presidio 5SE, Castolon, Johnson Ranch, Boquillas, Dryden 16S, Terlingua 8S...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Boquillas. * WHEN...From this morning to Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet (3.7 meters), the river reaches bankfull, and no damage is expected. Preparations may be necessary to remove water pumps. The park should be notified at this time if additional rises are expected so they will have time to remove the pumps. At 13.0 feet (4.0 meters), the river reaches minor flood stage. Water reaches the water pumps maintained by the park service that are used to water the campgrounds and to provide water to the employee living quarters. It may be necessary for park personnel to remove the pumps. At 15.0 feet (4.6 meters), the river reaches moderate flood stage. Water pumps submerge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.9 feet (4.5 meters). - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 14.9 feet (4.5 meters). - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.3 feet (4.7 meters) this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet (4.0 meters). - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (feet): Fld Observed Tue Tue Wed Wed Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1pm 7pm 1am 7am Rio Grande Boquillas 13.0 14.9 Tue 9am 15.3 15.3 14.3 12.0 Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (meters): Fld Observed Tue Tue Wed Wed Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1pm 7pm 1am 7am Rio Grande Boquillas 4.0 4.5 Tue 9am 4.7 4.7 4.4 3.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM CDT.
